tool_description: TollGuru Toll API service •	calculates tolls before and after the trip (by sending GPS tracks) •	calculates other costs for route (such as fuel expenses and for trucks labor expenses, other costs)•	provides the cheapest, the fastest and other compromise routes between the origin, destination and waypoints
name: Tollguru Toll REST
title: Tollguru Toll REST

api_list.name: /route
api_list.description:
The response endpoint retrieves all tolls on the single route requested. You will not receive tolls for alternate routes possible between the origin and destination.

Route polylines are map independent and you can send us polylines from any mapping provider like: Google, Bing, MapBox, Apple Map, HERE, TomTom, Waze, ESRI, MapQuest, JawgMaps, Trimble, PTV, MapmyIndia, Yandex, Michelin, Baidu, Gaode or your custom source.

For more details, visit TollGurus' map independent algorithm and how we deal with edge cases and common pitfalls
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://tollguru-toll-rest1.p.rapidapi.com/route"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tollguru-toll-rest1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://tollguru-toll-rest1.p.rapidapi.com/route"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tollguru-toll-rest1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

costs.description:
Costs object summarizes the toll cost and the fuel cost for the route.The fuel costs calculated from fuel efficiency (city fuel effiency and highway fuel efficiency) and the speeds on each leg of the route.

The tolls are added for all the tolls on the route for each payment type. If a payment type cannot be using on all the toll points on the route, the toll cost is returned as false. Else, the sum of tolls for the payment type is returned.

The tolls are returned for the following payment types:

  • Cash
  • Transponder
  • License Plate
  • Credit card
  • Prepaid pass

items.description: Tolls object contains tolls for all the toll locations on the route. For each toll location

id.description: Tollguru toll ID. Useful for error checking

lat.description: Approximate latitude of the toll location

licensePlateCost.description: License plate (video) toll cost. For example, Pay by Plate in California, ZipCash and Pay by Mail in Texas, Pay by Plate in Florida, License Plate Toll in Colorado, Camera Charges on ETR-407, etc.

licensePlatePrimary.description: Name of the primary license plate toll (video toll) collection system. Typically license Plate tolls are not discounted.

licensePlateSecondary.description: Name of the secondary license plate toll (video toll) collection system

lng.description: Approximate longitude of the toll location

prepaidCardCost.description: Prepaid card such as Nexpress, Nexus Card, etc. toll cost

state.description: State, province of the toll location

tagCost.description:
Transponder toll cost
For example, E-ZPass, TxTag, FasTrak, SunPass, FasTrak, ExpressToll, etc.

tagPrimary.description: A primary transponder that can be used on the facility. Typically primary transponders have discounts for each usage or based on volume.

tagSecondary.description: All other transponders that can be used on the facility. Secondary transponders may not count towards discounts

type.description:
Toll type:
barrier (for example toll roads in Texas ),
ticketSystem - ticket system (for example toll roads in Oklahoma),
distBased – distance based (for example ETR 407 in Ontario, Canada).

rates.description: Rates object that specifies conversion factors between currencies with US Dollar as base. It is useful when you are looking for tolls between countries. Say you are looking for tolls between Toronto, Canada, and Monterrey, Mexico. Some of the tolls are in Canadian dollars, some in USD and others in Mexican Pesos. The total costs are specified in one currency using the conversion factors. The conversion factors are based on dynamic exchange rates.

routes.description: Route information including distance, time, tol

costs.description:
Costs object summarizes the toll cost and the fuel cost for the route.The fuel costs calculated from fuel efficiency (city fuel effiency and highway fuel efficiency) and the speeds on each leg of the route.

The tolls are added for all the tolls on the route for each payment type. If a payment type cannot be using on all the toll points on the route, the toll cost is returned as false. Else, the sum of tolls for the payment type is returned.

The tolls are returned for the following payment types:

  • Cash
  • Transponder
  • License Plate
  • Credit card
  • Prepaid pass

summary.description: summary including distance, time (duration), name, whether the route has tolls (hasTolls), diffs object that shows the difference between the cost between the cheapest route and current route and difference in duration between the current route and the fastest route

items.description: Tolls object contains tolls for all the toll locations on the route. For each toll location

id.description: Tollguru toll ID. Useful for error checking

lat.description: Approximate latitude of the toll location

licensePlateCost.description: License plate (video) toll cost. For example, Pay by Plate in California, ZipCash and Pay by Mail in Texas, Pay by Plate in Florida, License Plate Toll in Colorado, Camera Charges on ETR-407, etc.

licensePlatePrimary.description: Name of the primary license plate toll (video toll) collection system. Typically license Plate tolls are not discounted.

licensePlateSecondary.description: Name of the secondary license plate toll (video toll) collection system

lng.description: Approximate longitude of the toll location

prepaidCardCost.description: Prepaid card such as Nexpress, Nexus Card, etc. toll cost

state.description: State, province of the toll location

tagCost.description:
Transponder toll cost
For example, E-ZPass, TxTag, FasTrak, SunPass, FasTrak, ExpressToll, etc.

tagPrimary.description: A primary transponder that can be used on the facility. Typically primary transponders have discounts for each usage or based on volume.

tagSecondary.description: All other transponders that can be used on the facility. Secondary transponders may not count towards discounts

type.description:
Toll type:
barrier (for example toll roads in Texas ),
ticketSystem - ticket system (for example toll roads in Oklahoma),
distBased – distance based (for example ETR 407 in Ontario, Canada).

allOf.description: If you want an accurate estimate of fuel expenses, you will need to specify parameters specific to fuel price and fuel efficiency as fuelEfficiency object.

fuelEfficiency.description: City fuel efficiency and highway fuel efficiency from request or the default values. Returns fuel efficiency units

fuelPrice.description: Fuel price from request or the default fuel price (including currency)

rates.description: Rates object that specifies conversion factors between currencies with US Dollar as base. It is useful when you are looking for tolls between countries. Say you are looking for tolls between Toronto, Canada, and Monterrey, Mexico. Some of the tolls are in Canadian dollars, some in USD and others in Mexican Pesos. The total costs are specified in one currency using the conversion factors. The conversion factors are based on dynamic exchange rates.

api_list.name: /here
api_list.description:
HTTP Request for trucks, buses, RVs, cars, SUV, pick-ups, motorcycles

For trucks you should specify truck weight, wherever possible. Some bridges and tunnels restrict trucks based on weight. If you are transporting HAZMAT material, please specify material type. If you do not specify HAZMAT restrictions and weight restrictions, none will be applied.

api_list.name: /route/download
api_list.description: The results will be available for download for upto 30 days by calling the API.

url = "https://tollguru-toll-rest1.p.rapidapi.com/route/download"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tollguru-toll-rest1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /route/upload
api_list.description:
This API can be used in synchronous and asynchronous modes. The default mode of operation is synchronous mode where the API response with toll information is returned immediately.

Asynchronous mode is used in the following cases:

  • Bulk upload of multiple GPS tracks files
  • Uploading large GPS tracks files

In asynchronous mode, the response is returned immediately with a requestId and requestedTimestamp. The results will be available for download for upto 30 days by calling the route/download API. Asynchronous mode can used by specifying the url parameter isAsync=true.

GPS traces can be passed in the following format

  • Upload CSV file
  • Upload kml file
  • Upload gpx file
  • Upload nmea file

The first line in the CSV needs to contain the attribute names. The subsequent lines needs to contain the data in temporal order. The following parameters are available:

ParameterDescription
latitudeLatitude coordinate in WGS84 degree (mandatory)
longitudeLongitude coordinate in WGS84 degree (mandatory)
timestampindicates the time and date, for example  2018-05-21T17:05:06Z (mandatory since tolls may change based on time)
speed_mpsspeed in meters per second (optional)
speed_mphspeed in miles per hour (optional)
speed_kmhspeed in kilometers per hour (optional)
headingheading in degrees clockwise from North (optional)

You can download sample file from here

Or use the CSV format file as shown in the table below:

latitude longitude timestamp
38.90479-77.026072019-12-16T15:45:23Z
38.90479-77.026062019-12-16T15:47:24Z
38.9048-77.026082019-12-16T15:49:25Z
38.9044-77.026042019-12-16T15:50:42Z
38.90424-77.026462019-12-16T15:50:49Z
38.90422-77.026862019-12-16T15:50:55Z

Take care of the following things:

  • GPX: Each trace point can have the following information:
  • Coordinates, for example <trkpt lat="38.90479" lon="-77.02607"> (always present), WGS84 degree
  • A timestamp, for example <time>2019-12-16T15:45:23Z</time> (optional), time zone UTC
  • Elevation, for example <ele>102.5999</ele> (optional), meter above the WGS84 ellipsoid
  • HDOP, for example <hdop>15.0</hdop> (optional)
  • Speed, for example <extensions><speed>21.9432334</speed></extensions> (optional), meter per second
  • NMEA: The information from the $GPRMC records is used. If an NMEA trace does not contain $GPRMC records, then the $GPGGA records are used.
  • KML: Either <Placemarks with <Points> or <Placemarks> with <LineStrings> can be submitted. Note: Folders with multiple traces are not supported.
  • KML files may not work if user is looking for timebased tolls

optional_parameters.name: isAsync
optional_parameters.description: The API will function in asynchronous mode is set to true

optional_parameters.name: height
optional_parameters.description: Specify the vehicle height to get accurate tolls for toll roads where tolls depend on axles and vehicle height

optional_parameters.name: vehicleName
optional_parameters.description: Specify name for your vehicle to identify the response json for particular vehicle

optional_parameters.name: weight
optional_parameters.description: Specify the vehicle weight to get accurate tolls for toll roads where tolls depend on axles and vehicle weight
